title: Bugsplatting after champ select in all modes
body:
Hey guys i need help i disabled my fire walls, tried flushing my dns, repairing the client, turning off all anti-virus. I just figured I would drop my errors to see if anyone can help me with my issue. The issue is that i get bugsplatted right after champ select and everytime i click reconnect it just does the same thing. Here are my logs

000000.000| ALWAYS| Logging started at 2016-09-21T21:29:34.059

replies.body: Having the same issue, log file looks like a carbon copy of mine, Ive ran through everything in the guide. Issue seems to have occured after a windows update. I meet min req (played before anyway) updated gfx card drivers to latest (although uninstalled geforce experience as it was constantly crashing when i tried to use it anyway) Directx is 12 on win10 anyway and up to date. I tried uninstalling the latest windows update and reinstalled it after it didnt help so windows is still up to date. tried a clean boot, reset graphics settings, deleted config file. tried using the hextech repair tool. Uninstalled the game entirely with it as a clean install and resintalled several times. Absolute nightmare, please help me fix it or i'll cry more.
Also have tried changing resolutions as mentioned below and nothing changed.

Heres the log file too. Almost identical to yours. I've tried literally everything to fix this bar reinstalling windows cos I dont have the disk around. Even if I go back an win10 update it doesnt work. Driving me mad. Left a ticket ages ago with all logs that hasn't been replied to.

Surely someone somewhere can decode this log to tell us what the fuck is wrong, or do we just wait for Riot to fix it with a patch?

got mine working. Used geforce experience to change the in game video settings to lowest (seems to be it being fullscreen it didnt like) and it would laod the game no problem in windowed mode. then i had to mess around with all the settings available to see what caused the issue and when i tried to run it full screen it got wierd as in border was in the middle of the screen instead of at the edge etc so my camera moved when putting the mouse no where near the edge of the screen. had to solve that by making my smaller monitor the main display to get it working in fullscreen again. Hope this helps someone else find the solution as it drove me mad. TLDR - try it in windowed (specially if you use dual monitors)

I'm not sure what exactly is causing ur issue, but mine was due to a video issue. See where ur logs show Resized window to resolution 1768x992? Well mine showed 1600x1200...all I did was set my monitors to 1600x1200 and I was able to load the game...I then readjusted the resolution from within the game.

> [{quoted}](name=slimmyslab,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ArBEu23E,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-09-26T04:55:28.820+0000)
>
> I'm not sure what exactly is causing ur issue, but mine was due to a video issue. See where ur logs show Resized window to resolution 1768x992? Well mine showed 1600x1200...all I did was set my monitors to 1600x1200 and I was able to load the game...I then readjusted the resolution from within the game.

This helped me changed my monitor res and I was back loading into game again.

> [{quoted}](name=slimmyslab,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=ArBEu23E,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-09-26T04:55:28.820+0000)
>
> I'm not sure what exactly is causing ur issue, but mine was due to a video issue. See where ur logs show Resized window to resolution 1768x992? Well mine showed 1600x1200...all I did was set my monitors to 1600x1200 and I was able to load the game...I then readjusted the resolution from within the game.

Thanks man, this made the trick for me as well !

I had to create a custom 1600x900 resolution in the nVidia control panel and the game finally started without crashing. I then modified the game res to my monitor's default res.
I think it's related to the shared config as my personal laptop might have the "1600x900" res but not my secondary laptop.

Bugsplat errors are usually caused by issues with drivers, game files, or hardware that's failing to render the game properly.  I recommend running through each step of the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to tune up your PC and resolve whatever is causing the error.  This should get the issue fixed up!

Tried all those steps, wasted a ton of time, and of course...nothing. I can't believe I just wasted my whole night trying to fix this stupid game. I am so close to deleting and charging back. I literally just bought a ton of RP, queued up the NA championship, and then try to play a game and the first time it ran fine, just in a tiny window...and it would crash when I tried to switch any of the settings. So I used the troubleshooting guide, and now I get the bug splat crash every time. I know it has something to do with this weeks windows update.

ps- I even deleted LoL and did a fresh install, and nothing.

Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can take a look and help figure this out.  There are a set of logs that you can attach to give us more context, which can be obtained by downloading the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367).  We'll respond to your ticket as soon as we can!

I did long long ago...still no reply, but it is sad that something affecting 100s of players, with the potential of 1000s more IF THEY ACTUALLY UPDATE WINDOWS, and it has been around for a bit now...why am I wasting my time trying to fix it at all? How can Riot not have a fix for it? It may be a windows update, but no other game has the same issue. I can find posts from 3-4 weeks ago that have the exact same error and logs, so why is it still being treated as some mystery? We should receive some type of compensation for the waste of time and convenience. Really pathetic, if you ask me, Riot is HUGE...making billions a year...and they can't even fix one stupid game. I went through this same type of thing before, and the customer service have always been 0/10. The game is beyond toxic, no one even seems to care. They randomly pick and choose who to punish with a broken system. The whole game needs to be reformed, starting with the devs who are suppose to fix these bugs...but including everyone. In 6 years I can't think of one good thing to say about LoL. At this point, I really just think I will be charging back and finding a new Moba. Hmm its 9/24 and none of our accounts have the "reward" that was guaranteed by 9/23
Who do you people answer to? You can't even do a free giveaway right? Can't make the game play right? Can't fix the community? How does such a bad company even exist in the real world? Oh ya, a bunch of mindless lemmings and toxic kids are the only ones that play on NA...
I already did everything and made sure everything was up to date and I still crash during the champion loading screen.
Same thing is happening to me, I got a leaver in 2 games now one of them being ranked and everything on my end is fine, i played a game just last night.

I seem to be having the same issues after both some epic Windows 10 updates and the 6.19 patching. I suspect the Windows 10 updates are the culprits. A cross-post from a couple of places that might help:

1) Disable the Game DVR under the XBox App on Windows 10. Click on the XBox App in your Start Menu, click the gear in the bottom left corner, click the 'Game DVR' tab under the Settings title, and slide the slider to off. This has reportedly helped some people.

2) Right click on the league client in the Riot folder on your computer, select Properties, click the Compatibility tab and then select "Run this program in Compatibility Mode for Windows 7". This has also reportedly helped some people.

If these things work (haven't been able to test myself), credit goes to a bunch of other people who figured this out. If it doesn't, I'll take the blame because it's what I'm good at. Cheers!

I literally got this computer 3 weeks ago. I fully updated it, and LoL worked fine. Today, I did another run of updates and as soon as I finished, tried to load LoL...so I am almost 100% sure it was due to the windows 10 update just this week.
Yeah I have been getting the same error and now have been put in low priority because of leaver buster.

Windows 10 just updated, and started getting this error too.   This happens even when trying to spectate.

I thought I was the only one. I've been trying to fix this problem for the past 6 hours now. used the "fix files" button, reinstalled league, turned off firewall, restored checkpoint to September 11th, cleaned registry. Nothing works. My only option now is to do a factory reinstall of windows 10 and cross my fingers. Hopefully someone figures this out.

I'm upset this problem doesn't have a solid single post for coverage, it's been happening to me for almost 6 months at this point, the worst part is oddly enough, you're still able to run maybe a single game with no issues, and your next game will crash out completely even though they both produced the same errors in the log. I just don't understand but I have a pretty determined techie helping me out so if we get to the bottom of this I'll let you guys know.

It is a old post but thought id post my solution.

I had this problem as well. and it haunted me a few day. I finally connected the issue since I replaced one of my 2 monitors.

The resolution of your game is stored in the game config file. Changing these values to match my new monitor fixed my problem :)

(also changed the ItemShopPrevResizeHeight, ItemShopPrevResizeWidth setting to match the monitor )
